arts.ttl: Tottenham injury latest: Son Heung-min, Destiny Udogie updates after Man United win
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou delivers the latest on Destiny Udogie and Son Heung-min's injuries following his side's 3-0 win over Manchester United.

arts.ttl: Erik ten Hag explains why Man Utd were destroyed by Tottenham
arts.sum: "We had chances and our moments to get back in the game, with Joshua Zirkzee and Alejandro Garnacho when we still had 11 players and then after the red card too we had moments. Speaking to BBC Sport after Sunday's defeat, United boss Ten Hag criticised the mentality of his players after going a goal down.

arts.ttl: Analysis: How Spurs outplayed Man Utd at Old Trafford
arts.sum: With Maddison often pulling wider to get on the ball early in a move, Spurs’ centre-backs easily passing through a haphazard United press (more on that below), and Destiny Udogie helping to crowd midfield, Kulusevski was able to find intelligent spaces between the lines to carve United open. It will no doubt be a tough week ahead for Erik ten Hag, who has overseen the joint-worst start to a Man Utd season in Premier League history.

arts.ttl: THE NOTEBOOK: Brennan Johnson shines on his dad's old patch as Spurs thrash Man United in front of Keely Hodgkinson and Lee Carsley
arts.sum: CHRIS WHEELER: It was a proud day for Brennan's dad David, a former Youth Cup winner at United, who saw his son score at the Stretford End to put Tottenham on course for a comfortable victory.

arts.ttl: Tottenham launch investigation into own fans' 'abhorrent' actions during Man Utd thrashing
arts.sum: Tottenham smashed Manchester United on Sunday to claim a famous win at Old Trafford, but the celebrations have been marred by reports of homophobic chanting from the visiting fans

arts.ttl: X reacts as Tottenham batter dire Man Utd
arts.sum: Tottenham produced an outstanding performance to down Manchester United 3-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon, and questions will once again re-emerge over Erik ten Hag's future. United's first big moment arrived when Joshua Zirkzee had an effort well-saved by Guglielmo Vicario, but that chance came while Spurs were down to ten with Destiny Udogie off the pitch having received treatment.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou gives honest opinion of Bruno Fernandes' red card for Man Utd
arts.sum: Bruno Fernandes insisted after Manchester United's defeat that the challenge was "never a red" - saying it was a foul but not a dismissal - but Tottenham boss Ange Postecoglou refused to wade into the debate as he hailed his side for putting "pressure" on the Red Devils

arts.ttl: Premier League Team of the Week as Spurs stars shine
arts.sum: Our Premier League Team of the Week from the sixth matchday of the season, which saw Arsenal leave it late to beat Leicester, Spurs stun Manchester United, and Everton claim their first win of the campaign. Premier League Team of the Week Goalkeeper: Mads Hermansen – Leicester City It’s hard to think of another time […] The post Premier League Team of the Week as Spurs stars shine first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Tottenham's Dominic Solanke joins exclusive Premier League club against Man United
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur's Dominic Solanke joins an elite group of English footballers with his goal in the Lilywhites' 3-0 triumph over Manchester United in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Postecoglou press conference LIVE - Spurs boss on Van de Ven, win and red card
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou is holding his press conference following Tottenham's 3-0 victory against Manchester United on Sunday in the Premier League. Postecoglou had to make one key change from Tottenham's previous Premier League game with Son Heung-min out with a hamstring injury and Timo Werner taking his place on the left of the visitors' attack.
